description:
As a Global Migration Practice Consultant, you’ll be a technical lead on an accelerated migration projects with our strategic customers while developing Google Cloud Professional Services services and roadmaps for customers' migrations. This is a hands-on role, where you'll be familiar with data center technologies, virtualization, orchestration tech, CI/CD tooling, network infrastructure, security tech, containers, and databases. You’ll propose plans, demonstrate components of it live to customer stakeholders and leadership, code with their engineers, and document and own the technical delivery to create a repeatable model for consultants and engineers to use.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in a technical or Engineering field or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in all cloud computing aspects (infrastructure, storage, platforms, data), and cloud market, competitive dynamics and customer buying behavior.
  • Experience with on-premises data center infrastructure and data center migration projects.
  • Ability to travel up to 30% of the time.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with one or more general programming languages, including Java, Python, C++, Ruby, JavaScript, Bash, PowerShell.
  • Experience with cross-functional teams, and track record of having developing professional documentation, delivering training, and published articles/books.
  • Knowledge of networking and web standards, including TCP/IP, HTTP, web security mechanisms, proxies, firewalls and load balancers.
  • Knowledge of cloud computing, virtualization, hosted services, multi-tenant cloud infrastructures, storage systems and content delivery networks.
  • Knowledge and experience with Windows, Linux and database technologies (SQL Server, Postgres).
  • Excellent customer-facing communication. Ability to work directly with customers and technical teams, and represent Google at conferences/events.
responsibilities:
• Lead migrations and customer implementations on Google Cloud.
  • Build core migration tooling and services across GCP products and relevant third party software.
  • Establish and drive planning and execution steps towards production deployments.
  • Write/develop deployment templates, orchestration scripting, etc.
  • Manage, drive and develop the Google Cloud Professional Services organization migration roadmap and offerings.
title: Global Migration Practice Consultant, Google Cloud Professional Services
